title: Video: Teams – MVP
content:
This bizarre new video from Miami based beat maker Teams for new track MVP is a visual delight, splicing together various scenes from 80’s music videos and iconic films.

Much like the music itself, the Ben Tabas directed video is dominated by the incomprehensible unknown, flashing sporadically between vibrant video game cuts to what appears to be segments of homo-erotic fitness tapes. There are some fantastic shots in the short clip, including the one featured above, and it’ll take more than a few watches of MVP to truly appreciate the density and complexity of this music video. MVP is a free download from Teams’ bandcamp, and the video can be watched below.

Teams – MVP from Ben Tabas on Vimeo.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
